pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:5.1: 16. The second training rule on swaying the body
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying their bodies and leaning them on supports while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:7.1: “‘I will not sway my body while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not sway one’s body;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:8.2: one should sit keeping the body straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:8.3: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways his body and leans it on a support while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:10.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
